hypothesis_content.title: Neutral-to-Bear Transition via Failed High-Volume Rally
hypothesis_content.statement: In NEUTRAL regime, when price rallies >8% in 48 hours on >2x average volume but fails to hold gains (closes below 61.8% Fibonacci retracement of the rally) while open interest declines, the regime transitions to BEAR within 3 days with 70% probability.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Failed high-volume rallies in neutral markets represent distribution (smart money selling into strength). Declining OI during retracement confirms long liquidation rather than accumulation. This pattern often precedes bear transitions as it demonstrates inability to sustain momentum.
entry_conditions: Close below 61.8% Fibonacci retracement of the rally
Aggregate open interest declines during retracement

exit_conditions.take_profit: Regime transitions to BEAR OR 6% gain on short position

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 35% of failed rallies see immediate recovery above rally highs OR less than 50% result in bear regime within 3 days.
